greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Minimal m>=1 such that n!/m-1 is prime.
mathematica: a[n_] := Block[{f = n!, j=1}, While[! PrimeQ[Floor[f/j]-1], j++];
j]; v = a /@ Range[3,75] (* _Giovanni Resta_, Feb 14 2013 *)
results.author: _Vladimir Shevelev_, Feb 14 2013
